description.narrative: This project builds on the experience of two health projects implemented by SDC in Dodoma region: Community Based Health Initiatives (CBHI) since 2004 and Health Insurance for Rural Population (HIRP) since 2008. Both projects are at an end of phase and have been externally reviewed. The findings of these reviews have been used for the definition and design of this new project. - The CBHI project has also shown that there is a need to strengthen the district health system and health facilities to respond to the demand created by the communities on the supply side. For this reason the new project will contribute to the ongoing HSR and Local Government Reform processes by strengthening the community perspective and addressing the systemic and structural issues pertaining to the interface between health services users and providers. To improve access to, quality and utilization of health resources and services delivered by an effective and well governed health system. Technical assistance provided at the regional level through on-job training has seen a clear improvement in transparency and management of financing issues at all level. The new project will support recent efforts to strengthen social accountability mechanism in the health sector (interface with the governance domain) and strengthen the functioning of the different health system governing structures of the Council Health Service Boards (CHSB) and the Health Facility Governing Committees (HFGC).
